website_summaries.verdict: Despite a few durability concerns, these gloves are an acceptable choice for women and anyone with smaller hands.
pros: Combines user-friendly features for comfort and support, including wrist straps and breathable material
Unisex style and sizes make them ideal for women
cons: Seams and padding have the tendency to show wear when worn for strenuous lifting

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, for two reasons...
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping for more from these gloves. I'll give you two reasons for my disappointment. First, there is little to no padding in the palms. Second, the velcro strap that goes over the wrist has the prickly plastic part face DOWN, which means you'll be feeling it stabbing you if you don't line up the opposing side. The good news is these two issues should be easy to fix: provide more padding, and reverse the orientation of the velcro straps so the soft foam part faces downward. I didn't throw them away because they're better than your standard leather gloves (?), but as soon as I find something else, these are going in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dan

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect sizing
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit correctly even if you measure your hand like I did. Also there are no returns. If you buy this item buy two sizes smaller and cross your fingers that it fits... I'll buy my second pair of gloves elsewhere instead of throwing away cash
customer_reviews.author: Glenn S

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality -- did not last for more than two weeks!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves only lasted for about two weeks of light use. Terrible quality. Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: D. Hildebrand

customer_reviews.title: 2 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice fit. Good grip. PS : The left glove index finger slots has almost given way after a week of use. The exposed thread (at the palm side) holding down the band has deteriorated due to rubbing during lifting. It will be matter of time the gloves will be other glove will become useless & discarded. Need to look at ways to prevent deterioration of the exposed threads. Rating dropped due to durability issues.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great seller, customer service is 5 star...
customer_reviews.text: Ok, had to sit and write this. After my initial review of 5 stars (love these) The wrist wrap started to separate from the Velcro just a little on one of the gloves. I did really like the gloves but couldn't really use them anymore. After mentioning this in the initial review the seller was kind enough to send another pair out no questions asked. The seller mentioned that they had not had any issues with the wrap tearing. I am happy to say that this pair has not had the same issue and all is well. I would definitely buy from this seller again. Fit Active Sports...
customer_reviews.author: Tatood

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Love these new gloves they fit perfect and my hands can breathe. I ordered a size small.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable enough
customer_reviews.text: I had the gloves for less than a month the inside lining is torn off
customer_reviews.author: Sowmya Gopinath

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS And Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Wow, wow, wow... and not in a good way. Not only are these gloves incredibly uncomfortable on your wrists (they cut into your wrists in the underside no matter how loose or tight you make them), but they are DANGEROUS. The way they fit makes the actual grip part loose against your palm, causing excessive and potentially threatening slippage. Just simply poor design. These gloves should not be bought by anyone. I implore you, for your body’s sake, get another kind of lifting gloves. Or any gloves. Or none at all. Basically, anything but these.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve probably had 20 pairs of lifting gloves in my life. These are HANDS DOWN the best I’ve ever owned. My gloves used to be wet with sweat then stink. Now not only do my gloves stay dry and not smell but my hands are dry. I’m not sure if it says machine washable but it does well in the washing machine as well.
customer_reviews.author: Oahoosier

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So far these are great, plenty of grip and comfort, I have large hands and the Mediums fit perfect, but that could change, I’m not sure how long they will last because none of it is double stitched, will update review when I find out how long they last
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for...for a few months
customer_reviews.text: I really like(d) the material these are made from...they breath and don't soak up sweat. They're very comfortable. The offer great wrist support. They were honestly exactly what I wanted. However, I've now had them for about a week less than 3 months (Aug 23rd - Nov 17th) and they are falling apart They're really only used 2-3 times a week. Stitching is coming out of the pads on the palm and the neoprene-ish material that the outside pad part is made from is breaking down/disintegrating. You can see this in the pictures. Man, I was super happy with them...but they gotta last more than 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Dollunit

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for a few work outs. I decided to purchase this design because my husband bought a pair and recommended them. I wanted to prevent the calluses and sweaty hands. I felt a good weight grip and my hands were pretty dry. Lets see how durable these bad boys are. Review update 7 mos. I have used these gloves regularly. I still like the design and size. CONS: 1. The palm material close to the fingers has began to tear. 2. The neoprene material has acquired a funny smell on palms. Possibly from sweat, oils, equipment. 3. Hand washed, Sun dried gloves. Funny smell never went away. 4.
customer_reviews.author: KaGu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grip!
customer_reviews.text: They remind me of grips I wore as a gymnast but covers the entire hand. Very comfortable. The only time I take them off is if I put a TRX move in my routine where my hands are on the ground because the web between my fingers gets a little annoying. But I’ve also worn them through those exercises and just pushed through and was fine. These are really great because your hands don’t get hot and it protects your hands and helps your grip for things like pull-ups. When you put them on, keep your fingers spread. This helps to not get the web to far in between your fingers. Definitely recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: 4theloveofdance

customer_reviews.title: beware of products made produced and shipped from China Amazon is still number one in my book
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered medium in these particular weight lifting gloves and they were way too big so I was able to actually sell them for the same price that I got them for because I wasn't getting them to make money I'm a weight lifter and a body conditioner and the gloves we're great they were just too large then I order a small and it was still a little bit too large so these gloves are primarily made for men not really for women but again Amazon is still great their products are wonderful and less they come from China then you're just taking a chance
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don't get it
customer_reviews.text: I don't see how these gloves rate so high. There not really gloves. More like some padding material with some finger loops in it. First of all the hard plastic imbedded to provide grip are not tacky in the least. The hard plastic actually makes your grip to metal slick. The open back concept interested me but now that I've tried this I realize this is just another source of instability. It's like wrapping a couple of washcloths around a barbell and trying to maintain grip. Sure they're padded but do not improve grip.
customer_reviews.author: Samazon

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in this product. I was so excited to try it out after receiving it, so I immediately took it to the gym to try it out. Turns out these gloves have absolutely no grip. It's so hard to grip a weight, barbell, or bar with this because the fabric is so thick. I kept sliding off the the bar while trying to to T2B, and snatches were incredibly uncomfortable with these.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for CrossFit and Regular Weight Lifting
customer_reviews.text: I love these workout gloves, but they come with some limitations: 1. They are NOT comfortable for doing pushups on the floor, because the finger loops cut into the webbing of your hands. 2. You cannot wipe your forehead or face with them and expect to remove the sweat. The material does not absorb perspiration or water, etc. These gloves are strictly for protecting your hands during weightlifting, pull ups on overhead bars, kettlebells, and individual weights and dumbbells. The material is grippy and very durable. Stitching is tough and durable. I wash them once a week, but dry on low or just set on a towel following a wash. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Panski

customer_reviews.title: They're OK
customer_reviews.text: These are OK. It's sure to help prevent callouses but the fabric is very thick between fingers and causes your fingers to stay apart when you grip a weight. It's probably better without the thumb hole. Unfortunately, I have trigger finger and chronic carpal tunnel so the finger holes tend to wrap too tightly around my fingers and they go numb after a while. I have other gloves that do not do this at all. I'm also very small and a female for any girls looking to buy. I got an extra small bc my hand is only 3" measured from thumb to pinky.
customer_reviews.author: ayse

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Lift Weights
customer_reviews.text: I got this item because it has the most reviewed and got 4.5 stars on it but unfortunately, this item didn’t work out for me. I used to go to the gym but when just lifting light weights, I’m still going to get blisters after working out. I also got an XS but still didn’t fits right on me. You’ll hurt your hand when you start to lift weights. It’s not comfortable at all. I don’t recommend this item to anyone. Try to buy an item that has a thick foam that will protect your hand when lifting weights. I hope this helps. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Sheena Mae Brock

customer_reviews.title: It does the Job but it smells!!
customer_reviews.text: Got the gloves for some small weight lifting. The gloves works good, it does protect my hands from the barbell and dumbbells like I wanted, it does fits my hand well and like the bands that wrap around my waist. The only thing I do not like is the terrible smell it have when I got it, it have a very strong paint thinner scents when I open the packages. After couple used of the glove the smell was gone. So my suggestion is to let it air out for couple days before you used it.
customer_reviews.author: Sang Lau

customer_reviews.title: Size up
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of these, I’ve purchased this style of gloves before from a different company but wasn’t a fan of the grip so tried these out this time around. Grip is nice, but deducted points for the sizing, they fit tight.
customer_reviews.author: James Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Work Great!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews, but these are great. I cannot do pullups without gloves because i'm still working on my form and my hands tear easily. I did a workout with nearly 100 pullups the other day and find these gloves to be excellent. I have average hand size, so large fit me just right. Sometimes with gloves like these, tightening the straps around me wrist can be problematic, but these are perfectly sized.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: I like that it is open on the knuckle side
customer_reviews.text: I wore itvto the gym for a week (4x).I like that it is open on the knuckle side. I do not like the thick straps which causes me to sweat a lot under the wrist straps. It also covers my heartrate watch monitor. Overall very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: swimbikerun

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for intense weightlifting everyday and I am very pleased with their performance. These gloves are lightweight, breathable, and very durable. I’ve been using them daily for the past 2 months and they are still in good condition with little wear and tear. Usually I go through weightlifting gloves in about 2 to 3 months so I am very pleased with how these ones are holding up. The gloves are also comfortable and do not irritate my hands or wrists even if I have them on tight. I would definitely recommend this product no matter how intense you go in the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels like really great quality gloves for low price
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with how these gloves felt on. The packaging it came in was a hassle free zipper pouch that you can reuse. Definitely recommend using their sizing chart, I ordered a XS for my 6.25” circumference and they fit great. Really excited to wear these out at the gym! I will most likely repurchase another pair so I have a backup when one is in the laundry. I really like how the back of the hand is open for ventilation. The material for the palms feels very thick and the non grip side feels durable.
customer_reviews.author: V0214

customer_reviews.title: Good price, quality materials requires improvement.
customer_reviews.text: After using them 4 to 5 times per week for one month. I can say that the price is great, feels good with tight grips, look great. One minor issue the quality is poor. After a months use noticing a few tears and starting to rip. I used them lighting for a few minutes. Bottom line, protection is good, qualify needs improvement. They won't last like leather materials. Update, I put them in the garbage today. 3/15/18 completely torn apart. I dont recommend.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jimenez Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I originally had a pair of gym gloves that I've been using for two years. They started developing a...funk and it was something I tried to live with. Recently, I noticed the adhesive strap on my right glove was all but gone, and it was just flap open during workouts, VERY ANNOYINNG. Plus, they made my hands very hot if I wore them during cardio. These are ventilated and only cover the palm. My only regret is that I should have gotten the XL size since I have large hands. They are a little snug on my wrists, but I can deal. Will definitely buy again, but an XL.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pride

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for your workout
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife, and she really likes them. The back is open so your hands don't get so sweaty. This is the reason she wanted these in particular. They fit well and are great for doing pull-ups, standard curls, and presses. She also liked how they took some of the impact off of plyo-pushups and also found that the wrist strap helped to stabilize her wrists on impact. The only complaint she has is if you're doing hammer curls with dumbbells, the little bumps on the palm of the hand are a bit slick, and the dumbbells kept trying to slide down. Overall, she is very satisfied and recommends them.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Wrist straps too short.
customer_reviews.text: Interesting take on weight lifting gloves. These really are gloves in the normal sense. There is just a palm pad attached to your fingers via a wide elastic band. It works.Only dislike is the wrist strap is too short. I apparently have large wrists. UI ordered the X-Large glove. When fully wrapped around my wrists the strap is too tight. It cuts off my circulation. Recent workouts have shown that I'd rather skip wearing these than deal with the strap and the lack of blood circulation.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Runsalot

customer_reviews.title: Awful chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: These were great for a while... until I washed them. If they had developed some sort of "armpit" smell, I would take full responsibility, but this type of glove is good at avoiding that. What did happen, however, is that they developed a pungent chemical odor that no amount of washing, freezing, heating, white vinegar or anything else would abate. They're going in the trash as a result, because they are stinking up my bag and other equipment. Per the questions/reviews, I'm not alone.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Gibson

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Just received these and tried them. I like them so far and I was happy that they were not sweaty when I took them off. They worked well with my weightlifting workout which is really important to me. This is probably my 5th pair of workout gloves so I will really know if they work in a couple months and that's why I didn't give 5 stars. They were delivered quickly and the only thing that really stood out was the SMELL, yukky. I put a laundry softener between both gloves and I couldn't smell the fume as much. The smell is actually nauseating.
customer_reviews.author: Julia D. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Kinda uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: If you wear a watch (Apple Watch for tracking workouts) it kinda sucks because the strap on the wrist is kinda long and it being stiff cause of the Velcro, you can’t really wear a watch and be comfortable. I had to put my watch on the last hole so that it could give the strap more space but it still wasn’t comfortable. Otherwise, good material and seem durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: been working out for 1.5 years with these
customer_reviews.text: these are hands down no pun intended har har, the best gloves for working out ive ever gotten since birth, ive tried those crappy gold gym ones just awful, and batting gloves and all that other nonsense thats out there, copper gloves what a joke...these are legit, the real deal, i bought two pairs just so i can rotate bc eventually after a week or 2 when you sweat itll need a wash but not a big deal throw it in the washer dry it like normal and its good to go, but in terms of grip comfortablility like jus convenience these are the best hands down
customer_reviews.author: Arnold lee

customer_reviews.title: They serve me well, great ventilation
customer_reviews.text: Workout gloves are frustrating. Most don't fit right and are either too loose, causing them to slip, or too tight. Another problem is your palms getting sweaty... making the gloves wet and prone to stretching. None of this is a problem with these gloves. Being honest, they are not a perfect fit but I don't think that's possible for workout gloves. They work really well when I'm lifting and they look very cool
customer_reviews.author: Kasim Waqar

customer_reviews.title: Quite surprised for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these almost a year ago and just got around to reviewing. Here's the thing, I bought them for next to nothing, figured they would be throwaways after a little rough use as I lift heavy in the gym. One year later and they're my favorites. I have a few other pair but don't use them. These are simple, breathable, hold your wrists very well, and other than having to wash them once they get a little funky, having had any concerns at all.
customer_reviews.author: aj price

customer_reviews.title: Must try.
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal product. Using it for heavy weight lifting at the gym. Feel so nice in the hands and the grip is outstanding. Keeps my hands cool, and not overheating or sweating. I will probably never go back to regular weight lifting gloves again. I have used Harbinger for over 10years, and this feels like a much better product. This company needs to keep it up, and great job so far.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but size.......
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but size is definitely not as indicated on their size chart. I measured as shown and it indicated to go with a medium. When they arrived they were too large. Should have ordered a small but there's not much to be done about it now so next time would definitely order down a size. As for the glove itself it is very well made and provides great coverage for arthritic thumbs.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Burak

customer_reviews.title: So far is working!
customer_reviews.text: So far is working out, I've been dealing with very sensitive hands; my palms get really red for anything and this is definitively helping me out. It has good cushion and what I like the most is that is doesnt make me overheat because my hands are not 100% covered the coverage is perfect. I've been doing CrossFit WODs without any issues. Although the cushion on the palm is on the thicker side so is hard to do a hook grip my fingers doesn't touch each other but other than that loving it. My hands are now covered and I can do my exercises without any fear of breaking my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Gaby

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, hands don’t sweat as much
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect gloves for working out. I’ve been using them consistently for 2.5 years now and I still haven’t ruined my first pair of gloves. They’re very durable and very comfortable, and I find that my hands don’t sweat too much when I’m wearing them. They also don’t end up smelling, which is great. Other gloves I’ve owned in the past weren’t as “ventilated” and would make my hands clammy and then the gloves would smell.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Useless if you’re trying to grip
customer_reviews.text: I was so hopeful about these, as they’re the fourth pair I’ve tried for crossfit. If you’re wanting gloves strictly for weight lifting they MIGHT work if you don’t plan on going so heavy that grip becomes an issue. They do help protect my thumbs for snatches, but I can’t grip the pull-up bar at all. I drop after one rep. They have tiny little rubber dots on the palm that seem like they’d help with grip, but they don’t. 5 stars for comfort, 0 for grip. Unfortunately it’s too late to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Gmom

customer_reviews.title: I'll never use anything else after lifting with these six times now.
customer_reviews.text: I stopped using straps on back day because of these gloves have such a wonderful grip. I don't think I can use any other gloves now that I've tried these. The palm of the hand has a very coarse material that looks and feels awesome and has a great grip. I was skeptical about the ventilated back side of the glove but it actually makes it was much more comfortable than my last gloves my harbinger. My hands are much less sweaty too after lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Olson

customer_reviews.title: Sizing help.
customer_reviews.text: I do like the gloves. However, they barely fit around the wrist. May I suggest that in addition to the measurement of the palm to the middle finger, you also provide wrist circumference data. Other than the tightness of the wrist, which I'm hoping will 'break in' a little bit so it isn't cutting off circulation, they are a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Martin

customer_reviews.title: Runs just a tad large
customer_reviews.text: When I first received these, I thought they fit a bit too bit. I always wear large on gloves, but on these I probably could have gone with a medium. I didn't like the fit at first, but the more I wore them, the more I got used to them and now I love them. Great for not beating your hands up doing pull-ups, rows, curls, presses, etc. They shine most when doing pull-ups. The nice grip plus the support around the wrist really lets you focus more on your form and less on just trying to keep your grip.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Nice grip, very breathable
customer_reviews.text: I love the style and breathability. Great for deadlifts and bench, dumbbells, etc. Pretty comfortable, although the wrist strap feels kinda stiff depending on the workout. I'm sure they'll wear in and soften up. 5 stars for durability but I'll update the post if they fall apart quick. Looks good and the padding feels great. Edit: I used the sizing guide before ordering and the gloves both fit great
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these gloves or should I say half gloves. I am not a body builder, but I do work out 3-5 days a week. These are perfect for me. I never take off my jewelry, and as another posted, I was concerned I would have to take off my rings. I do not have any problems. The only issue I have is the wrap around strap. I would change it to a single strap with a bit more room for adjustment. Other than that, I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: BuyBuyBuy

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are the bee's knees! I lift 6 days a week and require durable gloves to avoid callouses and for overall comfort; these gloves do it all. These were my first set of backless gloves and let me tell you, its a game changer. Your fingers aren't constricted AND they don't trap sweat and nasty odors near as badly. I still wash them every 5-6 weeks, but it hasn't compromised their quality at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kassie H

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, well made
customer_reviews.text: The gloves came in a nice and sturdy plastic zipper bag. They are comfortable for lifting weights, and they feel durable. I am not a heavy lifter, but I do use various machines, and these gloves keep my hands from hurting. The palm of the glove extends to cover the first segment (phalanx) of each finger. In some circumstances, I wish they went a bit beyond that, to cover the second segment. However, this is a quibble. It's really much more pleasant to work out with these gloves than without.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tomasi

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: I recently began working out and noticed that my wrists would bend up when curling, and that the dumbbells were hard on my palms. So I bought these! My wrists are a lot more stable, and the grip part is great. The open design doesn't let sweat build, so that's a plus. Only issue is that my hands are itty bitty and I ordered an extra small; every finger but my thumb fits perfectly. I've used them for a few months now, without the thumb part because I like circulation in my thumb, and they've held up pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Espitia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Fit & Protection
customer_reviews.text: I have used these gloves to lift all week and I am LOVING them. They give great wrist support and cushion your palms. I have a pinched nerve/blood blister under the skin on my palm from lifting without gloves and I am able to lift without any pain with these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Fitnessa

customer_reviews.title: Not for me. At all.
customer_reviews.text: They seem like they were made from decent materials but I could not fathom how I could work out with these. Since they have no backs they kind of just move wherever they want, plus with the hypermobilty of the finger wraps there is an inherent sizing issue. If you start closing your hand, the gloves come apart from your palms. A lot of people seem to like them but I felt like they were just an accident waiting to happen. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Patel

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: After ordering a size small which is suppose to fit my 7in measurements hand, I realized it was too and causing my to stretch for my to close my hand around the bar bell or anything else and causing stress to my forearm muscles so I returned it and got a smaller size hoping that would help and it did!! I reordered an extra small and it’s fits just fine and allows me to grip the bar with confidence, no more over stretching my muscles and no more cals.
customer_reviews.author: Jovanna Cordero

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE THESE
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable and durable, perfect for working out. Hand doesn’t get sweaty. They don’t pinch or catch anywhere. I don’t lift heavy weights, so these are perfect throughout my entire workout for putting hands on the floor or holding any kind of bars or dumbbells. No one needs a callous. I won’t workout without them!!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 15 year old son who recently started weight training in school. He asked for them because the bars were hurting his hands. We ordered a different type at first; he tried them and they did not help as the finger parts were hard and basically dig into his fingers. This is the second type we ordered, we figured we would try something else. He has used the twice and said they are much more comfortable and he had an easier time gripping the bars than he did before.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with these gloves.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 8 womens glove, and I chose size Large in this athletic glove. It fits fine. Perhaps I could have chosen a medium but I don't like a snug fit. The palm of the glove is large and protects the entire hand (and beyond the width of the palm for me) and over the first joint in the fingers. The wrap around the wrist is PLENTY adequate and comfortable. It won't be coming off during reps. No more blisters for me!
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably comfortable, good protection, hard to put on.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are made well and provide good protection while lifting heavy. The straps make it hard to put these gloves on and take them off during your workout. I don't want to leave them on because the straps can become uncomfortable when tight on your wrists. If they were more comfortable I'd probably wear them every workout, but as it turns out I only use them on pull days now.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T

customer_reviews.title: BEST LIFTING GLOVES EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: Hey LADIES(& gentlemen),, if you are tired of "man-palms" from lifting, then this is your answer. These gloves are so rugged and protective. I lift heavy 4 to 5 times a week& believe me if you were to hold or shake my hands you would not be able to tell. I've tried all kind of gloves from different companies and these are by far the most durabale and strongest defense against calloused hands and wrist injury. ...BUY, BUY, BUY! .. I'm glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: scola

customer_reviews.title: Worth a purchase. Feels and looks good.
customer_reviews.text: Have held up quite well. Was a bit tighter than expected but did eass up after a few workouts. Worth the money. I play volleyball, so my wrist gets a workload. Having this helped keep it healthy during weights.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Best lifting gloves
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought 4 so far. My husband wanted a pair after seeing me use mine. I got tired of sharing with my son so I got him his own. Ive Replaced a pair that we thought was lost. I can’t workout without them. My hands aren’t sweaty. I can still use my phone if needed which comes in handy when I’m using my timer or changing a song. They have plenty of life and I’ve had them for 5 months (I lift five days a week). Best purchase thus far
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves in June. It’s now September and will need to replace them. They have started to shred and fall apart. Also, there is no cushion in the palms at all. And the anti-slip traction on the palms wears off after a few workouts. After that it’s just smooth and soft. No help at all maintaining grips on barbells and/or dumbbells. I will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my boyfriend, who has developed callouses on his palms from lifting weights. I don't like his callouses so I went in search for a fix. These gloves fit his hands well (seem to be true to size); however, he will be returning for a simpler (non-ventilated) pair of gloves. He felt that these would maybe be a better fit for a more seasoned workout. He just doesn't simple machine work. These are perfectly fine though; just not for him. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: shannieboop

customer_reviews.title: Look Ma, No Callouses!
customer_reviews.text: No callouses for me! Love these gloves. I use them for my pull-up bar at home. Previously I used the bar bare-handed. That's not a good idea. I was developing small callouses. My only fear is the Velcro, as it will start to wear out. Wish it had tie straps for the wrists. For those guys who workout and who want to hold hands with a significant other, use these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: That Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great wrist support and protect the palms
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for about 3 weeks now atleast 4 times a week. Very good at protecting the palms and provide an amazing grip. At the same time gives good wrist stability. I have an injuries left wrist that buckled at time under heavy lifting without proper support. Haven’t had any pain or buckle using this product. I love that I can throw it in the washing machine and it’s good again for the next work out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves, Breathes Well
customer_reviews.text: Like these gloves a lot. Allows my hands to breathe while protecting my palms and supporting my wrists during heavy lifts. Had to knock a star off of durability because I ripped the grip out of a palm after 6 months, which never happened with leather, but as a testament to how much o like them, I bought a second pair as the replacement. Would definitely recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton Gerner

customer_reviews.title: these gloves are great for the advertised purpose
customer_reviews.text: They arrived just as described. Sadly I will be returning them. I should have thought to inquire about what degree of support these gloves offer the thumbs. I have Rhematoid Arthritis and hoped for extra support to protect my thumb joints. No, they did not do that, but YES, they did everything else as advertised. You should have seen my fabulous Burpees with my gloved hands planted to the slippery floor! My laterals were exciting. In otherwords, these gloves are great for the advertised purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Annita Yamasaki

customer_reviews.title: But I gave it 4 stars anyway because it made of good quality material
customer_reviews.text: The reason I bought it is because they have it in extra small. it's very hard to find my size. The finger holes are still a little big for me. There is not enough padding on the palms - I use it for yoga. When doing planks and downdogs, the finger holes gets pushed up in between my fingers and they get uncomfortable. But I gave it 4 stars anyway because it made of good quality material. It's also made for weight lifting and not for yoga.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Solved my two biggest problems
customer_reviews.text: Update - Just received my second set (left my old ones in the gym).... Still solved my two biggest problems and my favorite lifting gloves. In addition, they do not roll on my hands when lifting heavy (i.e. deadlift or shrugs).... I have tried numerous weightlifting gloves. Some have fingers that are too short. Some are made of materials which can't be washed. These ventilated gloves solve both problems. The finger length is perfect. The material is easy to clean. The pads are in the right spot. And they are not hot to wear... So far, they have been great gloves.
customer_reviews.author: James Potts

customer_reviews.title: Top class!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps your hands Cool, yet prevents blisters. Also fixates your wrists to prevent unnecessary movement and trauma. I love them and have been using them for 2 years and they still in top shape. you can easly wash them aswell in a machine. No problems. My overweight, nonlifter friend saw me in these and laughed at me calling these gloves girly. Thats a sign that they are awesome and he doest know what he's talking about! Best gloves Ive worn over my 5 years of workout. and I've tried many different gloves, even cyclist gloves and these were the best in overall practicality and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nikoloz Shaburishvili

customer_reviews.title: Good but.....
customer_reviews.text: Read a number of (positive) reviews on these before I bought them and have used them now for three weeks (typically go to the gym 3-4 times per week). The pros....they look nice, wrist support is excellent and they fit well....although I have smaller hands for a male and the medium seems to fit well. The cons....from the picture it looks like there is more support/padding in the palm area than there actually is. I stuff a lighter glove underneath and it helps. So had there been more padding in the palm area I would have given 5 stars. As is it's an OK 3.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Moscato

customer_reviews.title: Nice size but they stink. Can't work-out with that smell.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are nice and good size but they have a bad smell (like paint). I put them outside for a week but the smell still persists. Probably I will return them and look for something else that will not stink.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: Its good, but....
customer_reviews.text: Product is well built, but the neoprene dots which are supposed to increase grip, dont really do it... When I jump to do a pull up, they dont "stick" to the bar and help the grip, so I don't get the help I was hoping to get from my prior workout gloves... over all is a good product, but I would love to see the material on the front to be a little bit more "sticky" to help activities where you pull stuff...
customer_reviews.author: TLVNYC

customer_reviews.title: Save your hands when lifting
customer_reviews.text: My high school daughter has gotten serious about her weight training, and wanted to see whether gloves would help. She's already super excited – she was able to increase some of her maxes the first day because her hands didn't hurt. She likes the open design, the extra palm padding, and the snug Velcro wrist straps.
customer_reviews.author: Duxall Inarow

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, and comfortable! These gloves are exactly what I needed. Or personal trainer recently changed our routine and started us on high weight low reps... my hands fatigued with the bar as the weight increased so I looked into something to help with my grip... these are perfect, but I could have used a size up only because my fingers seem to lose a little circulation in the latter half of our 30 min session (and yes I measured and ordered according to the chart recommendations). Overall though, I'm pleased with the comfort and my trainer even liked them and asked to try my husband's on then asked for the link. :)
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews that I should size down and regret doing this. They fit, but just so-- I would have much more velcro to work with if I bought my true size. I didn't consider wearing my Apple Watch while working out and the velcro straps do effect this. The strap has pushed the button and turned off my watch mid-workout. VERY frustrating. I am working on a solution and trying to make it work!
customer_reviews.author: Tina P

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are rally real made and work perfectly for their intended use. The callouses on my hands were getting really bad and starting to crack. I always hated wearing gloves because they made my hands so hot. These gloves are lightweight and very comfortable to wear. Also provide a little wrist support. Great gloves and great seller.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Pietrangelo

customer_reviews.title: Very thin
customer_reviews.text: I had really high hopes for these but upon receiving I noticed instantly there was zero padding for you hands. I decided to give them a test run on heavy bench day anyways. the wrist wraps give little support if any at all and since there's no padding my left hand felt enticing l everything. The materials are very cheap and thin I decided to return because I already know these won't last beyond two months.
customer_reviews.author: ishoptoomuch

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, but don’t like them.
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving 3 stars because quality is high, and padding is impressive. 5 star quality easy. In real world usage though, I give them 1 star. They’re useless. Excellent padding, but only in the palm. No finger protection at all. I bought these to replace my old worn out gloves and after first workout my fingers had the biggest blisters. I know I know, soft hands, yada yada yada, but I prefer to workout, and have hands that aren’t covered in callus, and if you’re searching for gloves, I suspect you are too.
customer_reviews.author: Old Goat Ninja

customer_reviews.title: If you're consistent with your workouts stay away from these.
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend got these because her hands were starting to get calluses from deadlifting and she didn't want them to get worse. She loved the style and the extra grip they assisted her with, but they didn't last longer than a month. She's consistent with her workouts and deadlifts about 2-3 times a week. If you're consistent with your workouts and want a product that lasts longer look elsewhere. Also, she doesn't deadlift more than 185lbs for 5 sets for 5 reps.
customer_reviews.author: JoseF123

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but they didn't work as expected
customer_reviews.text: Both me and my boyfriend bought these to assist us with crossfit. I found them to be comfortable; however he did not. They were good for weight lifting but they did not have enough grip for pull ups and we struggled with the over all WOD while wearing them. Had to take them off half easy through the WOD and will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Not your conventional gloves
customer_reviews.text: When I first used these I was a bit weirded out by the design. I now realize that this is how I want gym gloves to be. Normally sweat is trapped in the full gym glove, unnecessarily. These allow great ventilation during workouts, easy to take on and put off and still provide great support and feel. Highly recommended. I have not needed to wash them as frequently due to the design.
customer_reviews.author: Silk Road

customer_reviews.title: Good but irritating
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the gloves, the feel and quality as well as how it doesn't interfere with me gripping the weight bar/ free weights. However, the wrist support is a bit too rigid for me. When I do deadlifts, overhead work, or any repetitive motions, it bothers my wrists after some time , no matter how loose or tight the straps are. I alternate between these and a regular pair of weight gloves. I'm hoping that with time, the wrist strap will be "broken in".
customer_reviews.author: Shawndiego18

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for pull ups!
customer_reviews.text: REALLY like these! At first, I wasn't sure-I thought they would make it tough to get my hand around kettle bells, bar bells, pull up bar. But the opposite! They helped so much with the grip! UPDATE: a woman in my group fitness class at the gym tried my gloves today and was blown away at how much they help with the barbell!
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for weights/beginners! Size S
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I'm a beginner in weight lifting and absolutely love wearing these! The grip of the glove makes it easier to hold weights without get tired or cramped easily ( I got injured years ago making my hands get easily cramped without a soft buffer in-between). I do more reps with them since I don't get as irratated in the hands as I used to. Cons: I wouldn't do push ups with them mainly because the fingers in the slots push forward and out rather than staying in place like other gloves, but still have a good grip of the floor if you're doing leg exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Bought specifically for deadlifting - happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought specifically because deadlifting heavy was becoming uncomfortable due to the bars ripping up my fingers. Was worried these gloves would affect my grip - they did not. No more pain from re-ripping fingers that are already destroyed by my rock climbing habits - I can focus on form and my back is feeling EXTRA thick. Good gloves. They look a little tacky. Also, I should mention that I measured into a medium... ordered a small due to comments and reviews. They fit a little tight between my middle and ring fingers, but I'd rather them be a tight fit than too loose.
customer_reviews.author: Lee M.

customer_reviews.title: size size!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 5'11, 165 lbs man and I ordered a large. I tend to wear large when it comes to my hands like rubber gloves or latex gloves when I was in the food business. So I naturally bought a large, and to my surprise they are actually a bit on the bigger side but its better than being too small! I also never used wrist supports before but I can definitely feel the need to after putting on these gloves. The grips are helpful when you have sweaty palms like me and dumbbells like to slip haha TDLR PRO - grips, wrist supports, comfortable CON - a bit on the bigger side
customer_reviews.author: Tien Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Best Workout Gloves to Get
customer_reviews.text: Really I am glad I found these gloves, I was starting to do pull ups at the park and I couldn't do as much because my hands would start to hurt after a while, until I bought these gloves and it made a big change, it was a night and day difference, if you looking for gloves these are definitely the ones to get, I went from doing like 5 pull ups because my hands would hurt too like 12 with no problem. I had workout gloves in the past before but nothing compares to this, definitely something to get and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Almost great.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a Large for me and a Medium for my wife, gloves run large. They work pretty well, don't get destroyed in the washing machine and provide good wrist support. Not so great for HIIT ground work like burpees or anything that you have to put forward pressure on your hands for. The fingerlings slide down and press against the webbing between your fingers making it hard to concentrate on the exercise, even worse if you're wearing rings
customer_reviews.author: Serene86

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves for Heavy Weight Lifting
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these weight lifting gloves! The memory form prevents blisters on your hands and they secure nicely to your wrist so they stay on great. Helps me grip barbells and dumbbells better so I can lift heavier. My hand circumference was exactly 7" which fit into the xs category so that's what I purchased and it fit beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Wilson

customer_reviews.title: (Almost) Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: The gloves (if they pass as that) are what I was looking for. Very comfy, good construction and good protection for the hands. The only thing they missed for me was the fit; I have large hands but narrow wrists and I usually get XL gloves. The wrist strap comes a little low, so I have to adjust it so it rests properly, but it's not by much. It it wasn't for that, 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jett

customer_reviews.title: Best weight lifting gloves ever!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best gloves I have bought. I was worried about the wrist straps since I haven't had anything like that before. They're great. They actually provide support for my wrists and don't interfere with any movements. The gloves are great when doing pull-ups as your hand doesn't slip inside the glove as I often experience with regular gloves. And they do breath better because of the cut-out on top of your hand. The padding is minimal so it doesn't feel unnatural or like there is a barrier between your hand and the weight. I'm very happy with my purchase and would recommend to anyone who is buying work-out gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Chris in Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the $$$!
customer_reviews.text: It works! Not a heavy lifter, used to prevent calluses. Can't comment on the durability yet, only had it a few weeks (Daily workout). The only thing that bothers me is that the wrist strap causes sweating. Minor issue, but other than that, it's fine. I also have the Schiek gloves which are $$, but very HD gloves!
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: These are great! They offer great support in the wrist and the padding is great. I don't get blisters or calluses anymore. I wear them on days that I do weights, pullups or use the burn bar. They are easy to clean also. I just wrap them up, put them in a laundry bag, throw them in the wash and line dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best lifting gloves
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this gloves to help with my weight lifting. What a difference they have made with my grip. Wow! They are awesome. I don't get the war wounds on the palm of my hands anymore. Also, my hands don't get sweating like they used to with other gloves I have used in the past. I can tell the creator of these gloves really thought the design process through. My wrists also feel supported as well. These gloves are very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Thick material and annoying velcro
customer_reviews.text: These gloves look amazing on my hands- two issues are that they are really thick so for people with small hands like mine, it makes grabbing weights more difficult because it adds a lot of bulk to the grip. Also the Velcro on the wrist sticks to the side of my pants a lot which is really annoying and can destroy a lot of leggings.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lee

customer_reviews.title: Saved my Hangs from hundreds of workouts
customer_reviews.text: These gloves have been through a beating and still holding up pretty well. the grip is starting to give way but for the price, I'm very satisfied with how long they've lasted. they start to smell after a week or so but I just throw them in the wash with the rest of my clothes and they come out smelling good as new. will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and breathe well
customer_reviews.text: These work well for supporting the wrist but also are comfortable to wear. They do not get hot because of the open design. I was a powerlifter and I wish these were around back when I was competing. I still lift somewhat heavy so I will update the review if they do not hold but, but they seem to be durable and nice so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Straps caused wrist pain.
customer_reviews.text: Used mine 3-5 days a week for several months. held up well, no problems. BUT! the wrist strap part caused my wrists to hurt on pull excercises like lat pulldowns. Stopped using these and no more pain, can lift heavier weights. These gloves were one of the worst work out mistakes I've made.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: Great for lifting helps with wrist support, shifts around alot when doing pull ups not sure if i just need a smaller size. But still a great buy
customer_reviews.author: bookaholic ge

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Palm fits very well and they are well made. My only problem is my wrists are small so the velcro overlaps and snags my workout clothes. This is easily remedied though with a needle and thread. I would certainly buy again but because of their durability, it will be a long time before I will need to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Lumen

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: These were the gloves I was looking for in the last couple of years. I've tried a bunch of them but always seemed to find an important issue, like lack of grip, comfort or stink. This one is perfect! It combines wrist support, an open place so it doesn't get stinky and the most important - a great grip for heavy workouts. It also seems to me that it has a great durability and was built with some great materials.
customer_reviews.author: Lauro Machado

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, not helpful for any activity that requires lots of grip strength
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for almost 4 months. I started Cross Fit and needed something for my hands. They have protected my hands and are very comfortable. They are fine during Olympic lifts and barbell work. The issue is their thickness. They are useless during pull-ups or TTB. They are too thick and reduced grip strength. During kettlebell work, they are too thick to comfortably get hands on handle. Anything that requires grip strength, they are not functional. I will be looking for something a little thinner so I can use on pull-up bars.
customer_reviews.author: davenport

product_meta.title: New Ventilated Weight Lifting Gloves with Built-In Wrist Wraps, Full Palm Protection & Extra Grip. Great for Pull Ups, Cross Training, Fitness, WODs & Weightlifting. Suits Men & Women
feature_bullets: FULL PALM PROTECTION * No more torn hands and no more calluses. This premium weightlifting glove covers the entire palm and the thumb of your hand is also protected. Made of Silicon Printed Neoprene, a high quality material which is resistant to water, dangerous chemicals, oils, heat and aging making for a long last durable pair of workout gloves. LESS RIPS AND TARES, MORE PEPS AND PR'S

BUILT-IN WRIST WRAPS * Experience these uniquely designed weight lifting wrist wraps that offers both men and women a superior training experience and superior wrist support with each and every work out. Excellent wrist support for performing Olympic lifts such as snatches, clean and jerks, front squats, and other lifts requiring wrist protection.

EXTRA TIGHT GRIP * Discover the one of a kind palm design of Silicon Printed Neoprene for extra grip on the barbell, pull up bar, muscle up rings, kettle bells, and more! Triple your work load with no rips, tares, or calluses TODAY.

COMFORT * The Wrist Wraps are tightened and loosened with Velcro, providing the user the ability to adjust to their personal comfort. The well thought out open hand design also provides for extreme comfort, giving your hands the ability to breath while doing intense workouts. LESS SWEAT and MORE VENTILATION equals NO BAD SMELLING Gloves, less washes, thus longer lasting crossfit gloves.
Order Now * And If For Whatever Reason You Don't Absolutely Love Your Fit Active Sports Weightlifting Gloves . Just Return It, And We'll Refund Every Penny (Or Replace It, If There Is A Problem)
